docs.lead_paragraph: People with knees worn out by arthritis will get more pain relief from joint replacement surgery, but it has more risks and there's a good chance that less drastic approaches also would help. That's the bottom line from the first study to strictly test other treatments against knee replacement, an operation done hundreds of thousands of times a year in the U.S.

headline.main: Study Shows Value of Knee Replacement Surgery, Other Options
headline.print_headline: Study Shows Value of Knee Replacement Surgery, Other Options

docs.lead_paragraph: The result will be the financing of fewer, but deeper, studies, to focus resources on efforts with real-world effects and life-or-death implications.

headline.main: A New, Life-or-Death Approach to Funding Heart Research

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health plans to overhaul its approach to heart research, investing in smaller number of trials aimed at deeper, more meaningful results; approach is high-risk but carries potential to effect real-world change  (Series: Mending Hearts).
docs.snippet: The result will be the financing of fewer, but deeper, studies, to focus resources on efforts with real-world effects and life-or-death implications.

docs.lead_paragraph: At dusk, the foggers come out to spray their sticky-sweet clouds of diesel smoke and insecticide across the Indian capital. Mothers scold their children for wearing short sleeves. Posters glued to signposts warn about the perils of neighborhood puddles.

docs.lead_paragraph: A program uses the principles of play for self-improvement, and essays trace the evolution of video-game intellectual culture.
docs.abstract: Simon Parkin reviews books Superbetter: A Revolutionary Approach to Getting Stronger, Happier, Braver, and More Resilient -- Powered by the Science of Games by Jane McGonigal and The State of Play: Creators and Critics on Video Game Culture, edited by Daniel Goldberg and Linus Larsson.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Krystal, who was forced into slave labor by the Nazis, focused his psychiatric career on the emotional scars carried by concentration camp survivors.

headline.main: Henry Krystal, Holocaust Trauma Expert, and Survivor, Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: Henry Krystal, 90, Holocaust Trauma Expert and Survivor

docs.abstract: Dr Henry Krystal, Holocaust survivor and psychiatrist whose work with concentration camp victims led to innovative treatments for post-traumatic stress disorder, dies at age 90.
docs.snippet: Dr. Krystal, who was forced into slave labor by the Nazis, focused his psychiatric career on the emotional scars carried by concentration camp survivors.

headline.main: The Effects of Seeing Asian-Americans as a ‘Model Minority’

docs.abstract: Does the stereotype do damage and perpetuate unique racial burdens?

docs.lead_paragraph: The case of the nurse, Pauline Cafferkey, points to how much is still unknown about the virus and its long-term effects.

headline.main: Ebola Survivor From Scotland Is Critically Ill
headline.print_headline: Scottish Nurse Who Had Ebola Is Back in Hospital and Critically Ill

docs.abstract: London’s Royal Free Hospital readmits Pauline Cafferkey, Scottish nurse who recovered from Ebola in January, reporting she is critically ill from late complication of initial infection; her latest hospitalization causes medical experts to question Ebola’s prognosis, long-term care for survivors and experimental treatments used to cure disease.
docs.snippet: The case of the nurse, Pauline Cafferkey, points to how much is still unknown about the virus and its long-term effects.
